Content:: COVI-VAC (codenamed CDX-005) is a COVID-19 vaccine developed by Codagenix, Inc. In December 2020, COVI-VAC started a Phase I clinical trial, involving 48 participants. The trial was scheduled to complete in June 2021, with results to be reported by May 2022.[2][3] On September 29, 2021, Codagenix presented positive phase 1 data for COVI-VAC at IDWEEK2021. Data indicates that COVI-VAC is well tolerated, with no significant adverse events reported and that administration of the intranasal vaccine was immunogenic and capable of blocking nasal replication of the virus with minimal viral shedding, recorded at levels lower than those likely to result in subsequent transmission of COVID-19. Furthermore, COVI-VAC was shown to stimulate both serum and mucosal antibody immune responses.[4] The vaccine is administered intranasally and requires a single dose.[2] COVI-VAC is a live attenuated vaccine.[5] In December 2020, Codagenix started a Phase I trial in the United Kingdom.[2] In September 2021, Codagenix reported that the trial had shown COVI-VAC to be safe and immunogenic.[6]  This article about COVID-19 vaccines is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. This United States–related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
